info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:51PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mineral, west central Missoula and southeastern Sanders Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 351 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alberton, or 19 miles southeast of Superior, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tarkio, Cyr and Stark. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 60 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northwestern and west central Montana.
